Description: Three fragments of undyed linen cloth. Two fragments (both a) are medium quailty warp-faced compound plain weave with ragged edges, discoloured buff to dark brown and impregnated with resin. The warp in s-spin at c. 38 ends per cm; the weft is s-spin with c. 23 picks per cm. Third fragment (b) is fine quality warp-faced plain weave with ragged edges., now buff. Warp is s-spin with c. 70 ends per cm; weft is s-spin with c. 30 picks per cm.
Curator's comments: Lack of spicing points to a late date (spicing may be disguised by impregnatio, but certainly not as frequent as one would expect from an OK textile. Information from Hero Granger Taylor 1992. The card that came with this object and is included in its photograph reads: "Fragments of linen from the sarcophagus of Mer-en-ra - Har-em-saf, King of the VI Dynasty. From the Pyramid at Sakkarah. Presented by W. Flinders-Petrie, Bromley, Kent."
Acquisition name: Donated by: Sir William Matthew Flinders Petrie
